claim: Parents share more genes with their child than siblings do.

supporting.text: Parents share exactly 50% of their genes with each child, as each parent contributes half of the child's genetic material.

attacks.text: Parents share exactly 50% of their genes with each child, as each parent contributes half of the child's genetic material.

While siblings share 50% on average, the actual percentage can vary between 0-100% due to random recombination, making parents' 50% share more consistent.

Identical twins are a rare exception and do not represent typical sibling relationships.
